title: Introduction to drawmap
text: Firstly, load map data Norway surrounding European countries load_maps_data().

what: Create a data frame with place names and coördinates
title: Introduction to drawmap
text: Secondly, create data frame place names coördinates WGS84 format. use data frame label map place names.1
code: places <- data.frame(   Place = c(     "Oslo",     "Bergen",     "Stavanger",     "Trondheim",     "Tromsø"   ),   Coordinates_WGS84 = c(     "59.913333, 10.738889",     "60.389444, 5.33",     "58.97, 5.731389",     "63.429722, 10.393333",     "69.682778, 18.942778"   ) )  coordinates <- load_coordinates(   data = places,   factor_cols = "Place",   mutate_val = "Some of the major cities in Norway" )

what: Draw map of Norway and surrounding countries
title: Introduction to drawmap
text: Next, draw map using drawmap::draw(). specify area data Norway European countries, well colours areas borders. , use sans font map. resulting map displayed .2 addition, add labels major cities Norway using coordinates data frame.
code: p <- draw(   area_data = norway,   area_col = "#512888",   area_fill = "#D4C2ED",   other_areas_data = europe,   other_areas_col = "#ADB0B8",   other_areas_fill = "#D9DCE6",   font = "sans",   coordinates = coordinates,   label_repel = TRUE )  p #> Scale on map varies by more than 10%, scale bar may be inaccurate

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eirik Tengesdal. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tengesdal E (2024). drawmap: Draw Maps R. R package version 1.0.0, https://eiriktengesdal.github.io/drawmap/, https://github.com/EirikTengesdal/drawmap.
code: @Manual{,   title = {drawmap: Draw Maps in R},   author = {Eirik Tengesdal},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0,     https://eiriktengesdal.github.io/drawmap/},   url = {https://github.com/EirikTengesdal/drawmap}, }

title: Draw Maps in R
text: goal drawmap draw maps R easily. package provides simple interface draw maps uniform style, particularly useful drawing maps multiple layers, countries, regions, points interest. package provides following functions: draw(): Draw map. load_maps_data(): Load map data using maps::map(). load_coordinates(): Load points interest coördinates CSV file. browse_wfsdata(): Browse data Web Feature Service (WFS) endpoint. load_wfsdata(): Load data Web Feature Service (WFS) endpoint. get_map_data(): Retrieve geospatial data via URL service (used load_wfsdata()). merge_sf(): Merge sf objects specified folder. harmonise_vars(): Harmonise specified variables across sf objects. theme_map(): Specify ggplot2 custom theme drawmap::draw() (font size). package built top ggplot2 sf packages. accepts different types spatial data, sf objects data.frame objects longitude latitude columns.

title: Draw Maps in R
text: can install development version drawmap GitHub pak::pak() remotes::install_github():

title: Draw Maps in R
text: yields map like one used drawmap package logo:
code: library(drawmap) norway <- load_maps_data(countries = "Norway") europe <- load_maps_data() p <- draw(   area_data = norway,   area_col = "#512888",   area_fill = "#D4C2ED",   other_areas_data = europe,   other_areas_col = "#ADB0B8",   other_areas_fill = "#D9DCE6",   annotation_scale = FALSE )

what: Draw maps with ggplot2 functions and sf objects — draw
title: Draw maps with ggplot2 functions and sf objects — draw
text: draw(): Draw maps ggplot2 functions sf objects. based previous versions Map Drawing Script R, offering consolidated method creating maps uniform style.

title: Draw maps with ggplot2 functions and sf objects — draw
code: draw(   area_data,   area_col,   area_fill,   other_areas_data = NULL,   other_areas_col = NULL,   other_areas_fill = NULL,   subdivision_data = NULL,   subdivision_colfill = NULL,   subdivision_col_values = NULL,   subdivision_fill_values = NULL,   subdivision_legend_order = 2,   font = "",   size = 12,   coordinates = NULL,   coord_size = 4,   coord_shape = 21,   coord_colfill = coordinates$Type,   coord_col = "darkred",   coord_fillcol = "red",   label_repel = FALSE,   label_repel_x = coordinates$Longitude,   label_repel_y = coordinates$Latitude,   label_repel_label = coordinates$Place,   label_size = size/ggplot2::.pt,   coord_sf = TRUE,   coord_sf_xlim = c(2.5, 32.5),   coord_sf_ylim = c(57.3, 72),   coord_sf_expand = FALSE,   coord_legend_order = 1,   annotation_scale = TRUE,   as_location = "br",   as_width_hint = 0.3,   as_text_family = font,   margin_t = 0,   margin_r = 0,   margin_b = 0,   margin_l = 0,   margin_unit = "mm",   panel_background = "#E4F4FF",   output_filename = NULL,   output_device = ragg::agg_png,   output_width = 5.68,   output_height = 6.5,   output_resolution = 1200,   attribution = NULL,   attribution_size_factor = 0.5,   attribution_colour = "#636363" )

title: Draw maps with ggplot2 functions and sf objects — draw
text: area_data sf object drawn ggplot2 area_col optional string object's colour argument area_fill optional string object's fill argument other_areas_data optional sf object drawn ggplot2, default NULL other_areas_col optional string object's colour argument, default NULL other_areas_fill optional string object's fill argument, default NULL subdivision_data optional sf object drawn ggplot2, default NULL subdivision_colfill optional vector strings object's colour fill arguments, default NULL subdivision_col_values optional vector strings object's colour argument, default NULL subdivision_fill_values optional vector strings object's fill argument, default NULL subdivision_legend_order optional integer specifying object's order legend, default 2 font optional argument specifying font family, default "" size optional argument specifying font size, default 12 coordinates optional vector object drawn ggplot2, default NULL coord_size optional integer specifying coordinate object's size, default 4 coord_shape optional integer specifying coordinate object's shape, default 21 coord_colfill optional argument specifying coordinates column passed colour argument, default coordinates$Type coord_col optional string object's colour argument, default "darkred" coord_fillcol optional string object's fill argument, default "red" label_repel optional logical argument specifying whether add ggrepel repel label, default FALSE label_repel_x optional argument specifying coordinates column passed x argument, default coordinates$Longitude label_repel_y optional argument specifying coordinates column passed y argument, default `coordinates$Latitude` label_repel_label optional argument specifying coordinates column passed label argument, default coordinates$Place label_size optional argument specifying label size, default size / ggplot2::.pt. due conversion happens geom_text objects coord_sf optional logical argument specifying whether use coord_sf, default TRUE coord_sf_xlim optional vector integers specifying x-axis limits, default c(2.5, 32.5), works fine Norway coord_sf_ylim optional vector integers specifying y-axis limits, default c(57.3, 72), works fine Norway coord_sf_expand optional logical argument specifying whether expand coord_sf object, default FALSE coord_legend_order optional integer specifying coordinate object's order legend, default 1 annotation_scale optional logical argument specifying whether add ggspatial annotation scale, default TRUE as_location optional argument specifying location annotation scale, default "br" as_width_hint optional argument specifying width hint annotation scale, default 0.3 as_text_family optional argument specifying font family annotation scale, default font margin_t optional integer specifying legend.box.margin top margin, default 0 margin_r optional integer specifying legend.box.margin right margin, default 0 margin_b optional integer specifying legend.box.margin bottom margin, default 0 margin_l optional integer specifying legend.box.margin left margin, default 0 margin_unit optional string specifying legend.box.margin unit, default "mm" panel_background optional string specifying panel background colour, default "#E4F4FF" output_filename optional string specifying output filename, default NULL. null, function save plot file output_device optional function specifying output device, default ragg::agg_png output_width optional integer specifying output width, default 5.68, works fine Norway output_height optional integer specifying output height, default 6.50, works fine Norway output_resolution optional integer specifying output resolution, default 1200 DPI attribution optional string specifying data source copyright information, default NULL attribution_size_factor optional integer specifying size factor applied font size attribution text, default 0.5 attribution_colour optional string specifying colour attribution text, default "#636363" (shade dark grey)

title: Draw maps with ggplot2 functions and sf objects — draw
code: norway <- load_maps_data(countries = "Norway")  draw(area_data = norway,      area_col = "#512888",      area_fill = "#D4C2ED") #> Scale on map varies by more than 10%, scale bar may be inaccurate

what: Retrieve geospatial data via URL service — get_map_data
title: Retrieve geospatial data via URL service — get_map_data
text: get_map_data(): Retrieve data via URL service sf object. Optionally choose save local copy data drawing sf::st_write() function.

title: Retrieve geospatial data via URL service — get_map_data
code: get_map_data(   url,   service = "wfs",   version = NULL,   request = "GetFeature",   typename = NULL,   outname = NULL,   append = FALSE )

title: Retrieve geospatial data via URL service — get_map_data
text: url URL service retrieve geospatial data service service list attribute httr2::url_parse, default wfs version version list attribute httr2::url_parse, default NULL request request list attribute httr2::url_parse, default GetFeature typename typename list attribute httr2::url_parse, default NULL outname Name optional output file sf::st_write, default NULL append Logical, output layer appended existing file (append = TRUE) overwrite layer (append = FALSE), default FALSE

title: Retrieve geospatial data via URL service — get_map_data
text: sf object

title: Retrieve geospatial data via URL service — get_map_data

what: Harmonise variables for subsequent merging of sf objects — harmonise_vars
title: Harmonise variables for subsequent merging of sf objects — harmonise_vars
text: harmonise_vars(): Harmonise variables sf object subsequent merging sf object(-s) compatible variable names. relevant example working GADM map data merging map data sources.

title: Harmonise variables for subsequent merging of sf objects — harmonise_vars
code: harmonise_vars(   data,   rename_list = NULL,   new_var = NULL,   new_val = NULL,   position = "after",   mutate_col = NULL,   mutate_suffix = NULL,   replace_var = NULL,   replace_val = NULL )

title: Harmonise variables for subsequent merging of sf objects — harmonise_vars
text: data sf object rename_list named list variables rename new_var new variable create new_val value new variable position Position new variable mutate_col variable mutate mutate_suffix suffix add mutated variable replace_var variable replace replace_val value replace variable

title: Harmonise variables for subsequent merging of sf objects — harmonise_vars
text: sf object

what: Load map location coördinates from file — load_coordinates
title: Load map location coördinates from file — load_coordinates
text: load_coordinates(): Load CSV file containing named coördinates return sf object. uses utils::read.csv() read data. function definition, assumed CSV file contains column named "Coordinates_WGS84" contains coördinates format "Latitude, Longitude". function uses tidyr::separate() split coördinates two separate columns, "Latitude" "Longitude". function also assumes coördinates WGS 84 format, uses sf::st_as_sf() convert data sf object coördinates geometry column.

title: Load map location coördinates from file — load_coordinates
code: load_coordinates(   data = NULL,   path = list("data", "raw", "NDC_datapoints.csv"),   sep = ";",   sep_col = "Coordinates_WGS84",   into = c("Latitude", "Longitude"),   col_order = c("Longitude", "Latitude"),   separate_sep = ",",   factor_cols = c("County", "Place"),   mutate_col = "Type",   mutate_val = "Participant home town/self-defined dialect",   mutate_after = "geometry" )

title: Load map location coördinates from file — load_coordinates
text: data optional data frame containing coördinates, default NULL path list character strings specifying path CSV file, default ::("data", "raw", "NDC_datapoints.csv") sep separator used CSV file, default ";" sep_col name column containing coördinates, default "Coordinates_WGS84" character vector length 2 specifying names columns, default c("Latitude", "Longitude") col_order character vector length 2 specifying order columns, default c("Longitude", "Latitude") separate_sep separator used separate coördinates two columns, default "," factor_cols character vector column names convert factors, default c("County", "Place") mutate_col name column mutate, default Type mutate_val value assign mutated column, default "Participant home town/self-defined dialect" mutate_after name column insert mutated column, default "geometry"

title: Load map location coördinates from file — load_coordinates
text: sf object coördinates geometry column

title: Load map data using maps::map() — load_maps_data

Load WFS data — load_wfsdata

title: Load WFS data — load_wfsdata
code: load_wfsdata(url = NULL, typename = NULL, wgs84 = TRUE, dissolve = TRUE)

text: url URL service retrieve geospatial data typename Name layer retrieve service wgs84 Logical indicating whether transform data WGS 84 format, default TRUE dissolve Logical indicating whether dissolve data, default TRUE

title: Load WFS data — load_wfsdata
code: load_wfsdata( url = "https://geo.stat.fi/geoserver/tilastointialueet/wfs", typename = "tilastointialueet:kunta1000k") #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 19.30413 ymin: 59.7581 xmax: 31.5867 ymax: 70.09266 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   rmapshaperid                                                              geom #> *        <int>                                                <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> #> 1            0 (((21.00936 60.22672, 21.00902 60.22529, 21.00712 60.22446, 21.0…

what: Merge sf objects from a specified folder — merge_sf
title: Merge sf objects from a specified folder — merge_sf
text: merge_sf(): Read Geopackage files specified folder combine single sf object. tailored importing downloaded GADM spatial data.

title: Merge sf objects from a specified folder — merge_sf
code: merge_sf(   folder,   layer = "ADM_ADM_0",   check_layers = FALSE,   wgs84 = TRUE,   other_data = NULL,   ... )

title: Merge sf objects from a specified folder — merge_sf
text: folder character string specifying folder containing data layer character string specifying layer read Geopackage file check_layers logical value specifying whether return sf::st_layers output file folder wgs84 logical value specifying whether transform data WGS 84 (EPSG:4326) coördinate reference system other_data optional sf object add final sf object ... Additional arguments pass sf::st_read()

title: Merge sf objects from a specified folder — merge_sf
text: sf object
